attribution: Library and University Collections, The University of Edinburgh

metadata.value: Detail of bindings from Shakespeare's Titus Andronicus. Shows crest of Edinburgh University Library. Thought to have been first performed as early as 1587, Titus Andronicus tells the bloody tale of a Roman General's journey to become Emperor, following his return from ten years of war in Gaul. Dating to 1600, this edition was donated to the University of Edinburgh in 1700 by William Hog. Sources http://www.shakespearesglobe.com/titus http://www.sparknotes.com/shakespeare/titus/summary.html
metadata.label: Description
